result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Paul Kluck

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 11:07 AM Defendant Travis Paul Kluck appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Anne Theresa Nack appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders Signature bond in the amount of $1,000 to be signed by October 28, 2022 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.D.V., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact directly or indirectly with Rooney's Tavern in Beloit, WI. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Defendant to contact Public Defender's Office or immediately file a Petition for Appointment of Attorney. Adjourned initial appearance set for November 16, 2022 at 1:00 PM
No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.D.V., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Rooney's tavern in Beloit.
Initial appearance on October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Summons and Complaint mailed to defendant on October 5, 2022 by Beloit Police Department.
